result.execSummary:
The defendant James L. Hoeppner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. James L. Hoeppner is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • James L. Hoeppner was found guilty of Possession of THC [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • James L. Hoeppner was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

AODA and follow through.
DNA Sample.
Ct. 1 - Dismissed without prejudice.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James L. Hoeppner

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant James L. Hoeppner in court, in custody with attorney David Gardner Casey.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls 14CM189 & 15CF74  @ 10:10 am. State gives plea agreement, 14CM189, Joint recommendation, reviewed revocation packet, 7 months jail, 65 days credit, Costs converted to civil judgment.  No changes to packet by Atty Casey, State has nothing more, Atty Casey gives statement, Def. has nothing, Court orders ct 1 7 months jail, 65 days credit, time served,  Court obligations converted to civil judgment of $404.90, Def. advised of postconviction rights.  Huber privileges. 

15CF74, State gives plea agreement, State moves to dismiss ct 1, w/o prejudice, plea to ct's 2 & 3, ct 2 withheld sentence 2 years probation, AODA & follow, 90 days jail, concurrent to 14CM189, costs, ct 3 withheld sentence  2 years probation, counseling & costs. Offense after 4-1.  Parties agree to plea agreement, ct 2 Poss of THC, repeater, Guilty plea, ct 3 Obstructing repeater, Guilty. Plea questionnaire & waiver of rights filed. Def. advised of constitutional rights Def. advised of elements.  Atty Casey is satisfied. Court finds pleas are freely & voluntarily given, and accepts plea.  Parties agree to factual basis in complaint.  Court finds factual basis in complaint & finds def. Guilty to ct 2 Poss of THC, repeater & ct 3, Obstructing, repeater. Court direct COC to enter JOC. State has nothing further.  Atty Casey gives statement.  No victim rights. Def. has nothing to say. Court accepts & orders on Ct 1 Dismissed w/o prejudice.
ct 2 withheld sentence 2 years probation, AODA & follow through, 90 days jail, concurrent to 14CM189, 65 days credit, time served, court costs
ct 3 withheld sentence 2 year probation, concurrent w/ ct 2 & court costs. DNA Sample & surcharge. DNA colloquy.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Def. advised of postconviction rights. Huber privileges.

Defendant James L. Hoeppner in court via video with attorney David Gardner Casey.  Defendant James L. Hoeppner in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint received, reviewed and waive reading.  Review of bond, arguments by Atty Casey.  Time limits for preliminary waived.  Def is on probation hold, bond will be reviewed if hold is lifted.  Bond will continue  Status conference scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
